title: Fantastic. Try to go with Enrique as the instructor
text: Our instructor was Enrique and made the experience amazingly enjoyable and secure. To be honest, when I walked in I immediately said I would not do the twister but after a trial with him I felt confident enough to do it. What a pleasant thing to do in Barcelona.

title: Best value for money and genuine Ecuadorian food
text: Very large dishes, excellent quality of food and the atmosphere that goes with it. A pity that the menu does not serve Ecuadorian beer but the rest is just perfect. Expect some queue.

title: Great view, sophisticated food
text:
Probably one of the most sophisticated cuisine you will find in and around Catalonia.
A real shame that a restaurant like this does not propose organic local wines on the wine list.
Else I would have given full marks.

title: Almost perfect but some big flows
text:
We found the view we expected, the location we expected but there are a flew flows with the value you get for the price.
First the bedrooms chairs have metal legs, well designed from an esthetic point of view but not practical: I hurt my toes several times because they were sticking out.
Second, no rubbish bin in the bedroom so we started collecting empty bottles on the desks.
Only a small bin in the bathroom. Very strange.
Then in the bathroom no Q-tips were available, the tissue box was... empty (!) and the shower stopped working at some point. I called the reception and no one could speak either English or French but eventually the water came back.
The sliding door to the toilet was very difficult to open and close, once I thought I would get stuck inside.
The above is a shame and not acceptable for the price one pays.
This said I would like to end with some other positive points than just the view:
From the hotel you can walk down to the rocks and enjoy the quietness, sun and breeze from the sea. The hotel will tell you that they are not responsible if something happens to you though.
We saw a couple of very cute wild cats that someone is feeding, between the hotel and the sea, on the hills. Very nice and kind and I hope it is someone from the hotel. It was nice to see them playing around in the wild.
In room dining and bfast was very good.
The hotel was very clean everywhere.

title: Perfect service and concept, excellent food
text: We just found there what we were looking for. Not cheap but the delivery is excellent. Very nice organic red wine.

title: Refined food, excellent service in a rural setting
text:
Really enjoyed our lunch. Excellent escargots, and amazing artichokes. Organic wine is available and the desserts were very nice, way above what you normally find in Spain.
Excellent service.
A little pricey.

title: Cute but forgettable
text: Great deco and presentation of the products. The empanadas are good but there is much better elsewhere in Gracia. I did not find the owner super friendly.

title: Greatly improved
text: This place has really become cute and most importantly makes the best espressos in Gracia. Super strong, best to take before going to the gym.

title: Could be so much better
text:
The place is as nice as it is on the pics, if not better. And the food is good too, with for Valentine's day, a few pieces of organic meat. That saved the review from going into ''poor'.
Now, the disappointing parts:
- No decoration on Valentine's day
- No organic wines on the wine list
- Cheap old English music in the background when there are so many good and young local artists.
- We asked for Champagne and we were bought Cava.
- We asked Cognac and we were brought twice Brandy.
- One of the waiters had his mask serving all along under his nose
- The water was brought with slices of lemon whose skins were full of dark dots from being old
- There was a very large rubbish bin in the wide open at the foot of the kitchen stairs. Doesn't look good in a ball room.

A shame because the food was worth the trip.

title: Nice typical atmosphere and good food
text: I am always worried with these tourists spots but since business is tough right now, even those really pay good attention. Service and food were good, and the value for price really descent.

title: Don't look at the location and the outside aspect of the restaurant.. the food is great!
text:
The first impression isn't very good because it looks like any restaurant but the food is really excellent. The type of place where you have not even finished you are already planning when you will go back.
Terrible smell of oil inside, which is a shame so don't go with a suit but your stomach will be very happy.

title: A little overated but worth a visit
text:
The restaurant is very beautiful and decorated with taste, the service is excellent and the food is good. A number of dishes made with local products are available and so are some vegan choices given.
The daily menu at 25 euros though is too expensive for what you get and the coffee wasn't good. Remains a place you must try once.

title: Photographic tour
text: We took what I had assumed would be a panoramic tour where we could stop and take pictures from the heights. Turns out it was mostly going down to the river under the woods then back up to the village rather than going on the top of the hills surrounding Villadrau but it was very pleasant nonetheless, beautiful and instructive.

title: Super deco, drinks, food and service
text: As nice as what I had been told it would be. I discovered the amazing Pisco Sour with nice food (not super sophisticated but perfect for the drink experience). Excellent service, stickers given as a gift and overall a very good vibe in this place. A little pricy so watch the drinks.

title: Nice!
text:
Nothing is missing, from the moment you book until you check out.
Very quiet rooms, extremely clean with modern fixtures in a beautiful house, decorated with style.
The bathroom is really big and shower gel + good quality shampoo are provided.
Slippers are provided
The breakfast is as good as it gets in France (I perhaps would suggest to offer eggs)
Excellent wifi
Safe parking inside the property.
Probably the best B&B in the region to discover that area.
Last but not least, super nice and non-invasive owners.

title: 52 euros to check-in a bag
text:
We got to the airport for a flight which is far from being full and we only had booked 1 bag while yet a suitcase appeared on both boarding passes. We were forced to pay 52 euros to check-in the second one, which is an absolute scandal.
I will not forget not to fly on Easyjet when business is back to normal and a wider choice of airlines is available.

title: Poor service, average food
text:
Untrained staff who looked all surprised/bothered because we wanted a table away from the rest of the guests. Looks like they have never heard of social distancing. Not a smile nothing, no manners.
Then when the time came to move to the next dish the waitress almost dropped the fork and knife on us, just one thing after the other.
Food was average, what you would expect when you go to the restaurant.
Shame because the restaurant has a great deco and projects a higher class feel to it.

title: Some big flaws
text:
The building has entirely been renovated but based on the outside I expected something more Spanish for the deco, with a soul. Instead you wake up and you could be anywhere if you look around you. Very Ikea looking.
Then the bathroom is modern yes but the shower leaks into the toilets so the esthetic is there but it is already not working.
Finally and perhaps most importantly, some big flaws: I came in and asked if I could be given the details of a private guide. I was answered yes and that I would be called back. I never was and the person at the reception saw me after that in several occasions.
We also were trying to call the reception, with no number we could find to dial in the room. I was dialing 9 and it turns out that it is 7000. How intuitive.
Perhaps the biggest flaw: the hotel has stairs right when you walk in almost. Not welcoming.
The good sides: it is clean, there is a nice terrace with a little pool and a bar, the ideally located if you want to visit both city sides around the bridge and at the moment, good value for money.

title: The other vibe of Seville
text: Really worth visiting for its excellent restaurants and a vibe which is very different than "the other side". A lot more gypsy.

title: Visit the Parc around it too
text: Probably one of the most beautiful and spectacular buildings in Europe. You can't get enough of the colors and shape, really worth a visit.

title: Average attention to the client
text: We went there twice and although there is a good list of cocktails and alcohols, surprisingly there was no cranberry juice. Some of the staff is young and a little pretentious, you have to call several times before someone pays attention to you and we had an issue with a cocktail which was served in a glass full to the top of ice where I could barely get two zips of liquid. It was not charged but this is not the gesture we were waiting for.

title: Saved us on a Sunday morning
text: Everything was closed in Seville and we could fortunately get some very decent food there, good coffee and excellent service. They are very careful with hygiene and Covid measures. The building is also beautiful

title: Breath taking and so well organized
text: A trip to the glorious past of Andalusia and Spain. An architectural jewel and amazing symbol of what mixing cultures can bring of positive and long lasting.

title: The Versailles of Spain
text: We did the visit with an audio guide and were blown away. Such much beauty and history in one place.

title: Must do in Sevilla. Ask for Filippo
text: Thank you Filippo for those 2.5 hours of delight and trip in history. Such a professional guide and organized company.

title: Impeccable
text:
Top service, perfect social distancing and excellent, fine and fresh food.
No organic wine on the list and yet we were served an amazing biological wine from Seville that was amazing after the zelious waiter asked the cellar.
Great value for money, a must. Nice to feel this 350 years company.

title: Wow
text:
Normally you will expect restaurants in such a touristy area to be tourists traps.
Well, those guys are serious.
I ate shrimps in la tinta that I will never forget and all the other dishes were delicious and presented in an exquisite way.
The (Italian) coffee was delicious and the service from Nabil just as good as it gets. This guy should teach junior floor staff how to serve.
Just fab. Thank you!
P.S Toilets super clean

title: Still amazing but...
text: The food is as good as it always was: jamon, shrimps in garlic, amazing cheese and rude service which somewhat gives a genuine feel to this place which is ageless BUT no local organic wines? What? This is not acceptable and really disappointing.

title: Open air cinema
text:
What a delightful idea for this hotel to have created this open air cinema. Amazing views, very comfortable long chairs, excellent cocktails, blankets and umbrelas provided (if needed).
We had dinner earlier the jamon was amazing, the tomato salad lacked a bit of salt but it was saved by an excellent organic local red wine. Local mineral water was also available (unfortunately not sparkling).
Overall a wonderful Sunday night, as good as they can get.

title: Nice view (not 360 as adverstised though) and top service
text:
Great place for sophisticated cocktails by the pool. The place offers a nice view and provides all the privacy you may need for a downtown meeting.
Service over the top.

title: Splendid but spoiled by no organic wines on the wine list
text:
Clean, classy, one of the best fishes cooked in salt I had ever and an excellent service provided by Opu.
Very interesting desserts card and fresh fruit available (big plus).
Real disappointement though that natural or at least ecological wines are not on the wine list.

title: Perfect
text: Excellent Thai salad and a good choice of natural red wines. What more to ask? Good service and a very cute location. Just the place is quite (too) small.

title: Surprising and so enjoyable
text:
We ran into this place by chance. Long menu of appetizing dishes made all in house with some with local emblematic products (fourme de Montbrison).
The taste was perfect and the choice of wines included two organic local ones. The house wine by the glass was also excellent.
Finally the dessert also home made was out of this world.
Not surprisingly all tables were booked.
Last but not least, the waitress helped me double check the bill which only few do and I really appreciated that.
Overall, excellent value for price.

title: Deceiving and bad service
text:
This place should be an ideal romantic spot on the lake. Instead it is run by people who not only don't smile when they see you but look and talk aggressively. Zero commercial sense.
The seats by the lake are right in the front of the ventilator from the kitchen which at night blows heavy winds of kitchen oil.
Quite a shame.

title: Nice, tasty and efficient
text:
You walk in and you already know what you will be eating and how much it is going to cost so no bad surprises.
Simple but tasty food made with ingredients from local producers which is great and a very efficient and nice service from a dynamic young waitress.

title: Excellent appetizers and red wine
text: Nice place with good service although not very friendly. Excellent appetizers, jamon and red wine. Good location to get a taxi and what seems to be historical deco.

title: Poor service, bad organization and mediocre food
text:
So at night you have to wait a precise time to get in, when others are kicked out at the same precise time.
Service was awkward, no organice wine available and although the menu looked appetizing what you get in your dish is mediocre.
Didn't like the deco but that is subjective.

title: Worse service in Granada
text:
Waiters all talking at the bar, terrible attitude given to the clients and food made with industrial ingredients. I had a leaf of basil in a basil and mozzarella salad with very cold lettuce and mozzarella that tasted more like cheddar.
Horrible.

title: Pic is misleading
text:
The pool is very small and the location very much on its own. The price we got was great and the room very clean with excellent bathroom amenities but not memorable.
The service was decent but overall not as Andalousian as one would expect in such a historical city.

title: Thank you
text: Thank you for this special moment, for those great artists and for the place itself which feels so out of anything I know.

title: Excellent service excellent cocktails
text: The place is ideally located and very peaceful. The service we had was excellent and the value for money is really worth it.

title: Must visit in your lifetime
text: A tour in August with so few people felt privileged. This place is one of the most beautiful things I have seen in my life.

title: Exceptional and genuine
text: I seldom eat meat but the piece I had was just delicious. Very wide variety on the menu, excellent ham and amazing anchovies with an unusual long list of desserts and what's great, fresh fruit is available. Shame that no organic wines are on the list though so I give is 4 stars instead of 5.

title: Forget about asking anything that is not in the menu
text: Great location, mediocre food. Service is minimal, only the fresh orange juices are good and the coffee excellent. Shame, they could do much better.

title: Spectacular
text:
A tomato salad to remember (!) and a pulpo that kicked the fresh one I had had years ago on Ischia out.
Outstanding food and as importantly, a wine list that starts with natural wines! Amazing!
The service was unprofessional but friendly and the place is magnificent.
Already want to go back.

title: Not what I expected
text:
We arrived and there was no water in the fridge and no bathroom amenities, despite the fact that fruits and coffee/tea/small snacks are not the table.
The place in itself is very pretty, view amazing but the water from the pool, even in August, was too cold to stay in.
The area is perfect, everything you need to see in Granada isn't too far and there are good restaurants around.
P.S The beds and pillows were very comfortable.
Unfortunately the rooms are not so proof so we could hear our neighbors talking and one woke up one morning at 5am with the music on.
Not likely that I go back unfortunately.

title: Very good food. Service could be better
text:
Nice original dishes and excellent classic.
Could have given 4 stars but the lack of organic red wine is a big no no in a wine making region.
Service could be better but overall decent and solid.

title: Outstanding,marvelous
text:
Every cent you spend there is worth it: the room, the view, the food, the pool and beach, the atmosphere and customer service.
(I would only suggest to put a rubbish bin in the bedroom).
Amazing bathroom amenities, parking facilities, the place is just perfect and frankly deserves and extra *.
Everything was impeccable and made guests feel very safe with excellent Covid measures.

title: Worse customer service ever
text:
My partner and I had booked a night for the w.e and because I am Gold with Hotels.com, I normally get a late check-out.
Well when I asked, I was abruptly told that I could "only get into the room at 4pm on Sat (half of the day is gone by the time you get to the pool) and would have to check out at noon the next day and that would also mean I would not be able to use the pool after 12".
"Not more later under any concept".
That really makes you feel special.
Well I took my money and went to a 4+* in Calonge where you could get into the room at 3pm and I was given a late check-out.
So not only Trias lost me as a client but because we are from here, all the recommendations I will now make for the other hotel to our friends and business partners visiting.

title: Amazing, a must visit in the region
text: Exceptional site, secluded, clean, offering wonderful water sports with lockers and shower and an excellent service (you can pay by credit card which is rare in France).

title: Good meal and nice little hotel in a very cute village
text:
Some memorable dishes (foie grass with blueberries and apples) and nice desserts although too big perhaps. The food overall is a little overrated compared to the other two "stars" in the region but the quality of food is there.
A bit disappointed with only one choice of organic red wine.
Birds at the entrance of the restaurant are nice but is it really hygienical?
The rooms are super clean (not crazy about the color of the toilet paper) but very quiet and the breakfast is excellent with local products and an excellent coffee (quality and machine).

title: Too expensive for what it is
text: Good location (highway,shopping mall), good toilet paper, bathroom amenities but cheap breakfast buffet, from which you can see a messy kitchen. For that price one would expect fresh orange juice and warm bread.
place: Hotel ibis Styles Saint Julien en Genevois Vitam

title: Most inefficient tourist attraction
text:
Good luck if you want to do anything but swim them.
The tourism office gives you a number if you want to rent a pedalo and what you get is an answering machine (in French of course) asking you to book ahead on a bad website and gives you an email address that one can't understand on the recorded message.
No way you can just call and set something up the same day.
The nearby port of Bully or even Cordelle have friendly people picking up the phone who will be very happy to organize something nice for you the same day.

title: Excellent food, tatooed waiters
text:
Excellent choice and quality of meats, convenient location even if in summer there is no place inside with air cond.
The tatooed waiters give a weird look/vibe to the place which is quite traditional in the end.

title: Amazing pools, service and pool food menu
text:
Kudos to the staff at the pool, the cooks for the excellent menu and variety of healthy dishes and the overall service from the hotel, right from the entrance.
Such a delightful experience, and all the privacy one needs.

title: La classe
text:
Spectacular view of course, good music for the atmosphere and excellent food even if a little on the expensive side.
The service felt a little rush at times but overall we felt that we were having an exclusive moment.
One of the managers who was walking around with an ear piece had his mask below his nose at all times and I even saw him talking to clients mask down, not acceptable but luckily he was not close to us.

title: Really, really good
text:
Fine cuisine, tapas with a twist and High quality ingredients. Small portions, tasty and elegant.
There was only one choice of organic red but a decent one.
Service ok. You get there at 8 and a 10 you are kindly told told pay the bill and leave the table to someone else.
But still a must visit.

title: Excellent products, great presentation and service
text:
Finally a place in the region where ingredients are carefully selected, the presentation very nice and the service excellent in a historical building with a very nice view.
Take away is available.

title: One of the best value for price in the region, great cooking and local products
text:
This place has really gotten better. The meat is now from the region and the wine list includes a few organic wines of very good quality. The snales and the cheeses are out of this world.
The place is opened on Sundays and Mondays, big plus.

title: Excellent dough but the toppings are common
text: The dough is one of the best you will find in that area but it is a shame that the toppings are so common. This said, the service was excellent and the owner is a very friendly guy.
